reload_failed.value: Can not reload. Please try again later.

status_desc.value: Twonky allows you to wirelessly and automatically synchronize content between devices running select Twonky applications. You will just need to enable syncing and set the folders you want to share.

users_desc.value: User accounts are used to control access to shared folders. You will need to enter a username and password to grant applications access to shared folders. If security is not a concern, you can set up anonymous access for shared folders, so that you will not need to enter a username or password.

users_subdesc.value: You can create or delete user accounts through this page. To delete an existing user, select the user from the list and click "Delete". To add a new user account, click on the "Add New User" button and enter the desired username and password.

no_user_added.value: No user accounts are associated with this server. You may click on the "Add New User" button below to create one.

shared_folders_desc.value: Create a shared folder to make that folder’s content available to other servers on your network.

share_name_desc.value: Share Name: The name you will use to find this folder’s content over the network. For example, "My Videos".

local_folder_desc.value: Local Folder: Enter the path where the folder is located on this computer. For example, "c:\videos".

user_name_desc.value: User Name: You can enter a single user account to require a username and password for secure access to your content. For open access without any username / password, select "Any" from the user list.

rights_desc.value: Rights: You can set access rights for the shared folder. Choose R/W for both read and write access or R/O for read-only access.

no_shares.value: You are not sharing folders on this server. You may enter the information below to create a shared folder.

shared_folders_new_share_info.value: Enter information to create a new shared folder:

tooltip_local_folder.value: Enter location path to any local folder.

administration_desc.value: You can restrict access to the TwonkyServer configuration pages by setting the following options:

administration_desc_1.value: Update the administrator username and password used to access this site.

administration_desc_2.value: Allow open access to this configuration site by clicking "Disable Password Check".

administration_desc_3.value: Reset the site username and password setting to the factory defaults.

authentication_not_enabled.value: Authentication is not enabled for accessing this configuration site.

authentication_enabled.value: Authentication is currently enabled for accessing this configuration site.

authentication_disabled.value: Authentication is disabled for configuration screen access. Enter username and password to enable.

tooltip_reset_admin.value: Resets admin credentials to default settings.

tooltip_disable_admin.value: Clicking this disables the need to enter a username/password to access this site.

server_unavailable_desc.value: TwonkyServer is temporarily unavailable. Please try refreshing this page or starting the server from the Services menu.

dialog_admin_acc_could_not_update.value: Admin account could not be updated.

dialog_admin_acc_prob_disabling.value: There was a problem disabling admin access. Please try again.

dialog_server_req_failed.value: Failed to retrieve information from TwonkyServer.

dialog_invalid_share_name_1.value: Invalid Share Name. Share name should be a single word and can’t have multiple ’{0}’ in between words. For example, "{1}share" or "share" is valid, but "{2}some{3}share{4}" is invalid.

dialog_invalid_share_name_2.value: Invalid Share Name. Share name should be a single word and can not have ’{0}’ in the name.

dialog_reserve_user_name.value: "{0}" is a system used keyword and can not be a username for server shares.

dialog_can_not_load_lang.value: Can not load the {0} language file.

dialog_delete_user.value: Deleting "{0}" will set anonymous access for shares associated with "{1}". If you confirm, these shares will not require any authentication.
